| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  | [monst.c#line461](/wiki/Monst.c#line461 "Monst.c") |

A **dwarf lord**, h, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. A dwarf lord is a [humanoid](/wiki/Humanoid_\(monster_class\) "Humanoid (monster class)") monster that is a [stronger](/wiki/Strong "Strong") type of [dwarf](/wiki/Dwarf_\(monster_attribute\) "Dwarf (monster attribute)"), possessing [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision") and the ability to [tunnel](/wiki/Tunnel "Tunnel") with a digging tool like other dwarves.

A dwarf lord has two weapon attacks.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Dwarf lords are known as **dwarf leaders**, with "lord" and "lady" being gendered titles.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 Variants](#Variants)

  - [4.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [4.2 GruntHack](#GruntHack)
  - [4.3 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [4.4 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [4.5 xNetHack](#xNetHack)
  - [4.6 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [4.7 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)

- [5 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

Randomly-generated dwarf lords are always peaceful towards [dwarven](/wiki/Dwarf_\(starting_race\) "Dwarf (starting race)") and [gnomish](/wiki/Gnome_\(starting_race\) "Gnome (starting race)") characters, and will mostly be peaceful towards other [lawful](/wiki/Lawful "Lawful") characters. Dwarf lords do not appear in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom") due to being lawful. A [dwarf](/wiki/Dwarf_\(monster\) "Dwarf (monster)") can [grow up](/wiki/Grow_up "Grow up") into a dwarf lord, and a dwarf lord can grow up into a [dwarf king](/wiki/Dwarf_king "Dwarf king").

In addition to random generation, a dwarf lord may appear as the random [h](/wiki/Humanoid_\(monster_class\) "Humanoid (monster class)") that is generated on level creation for each of the filler levels in the [Gnomish Mines](/wiki/Gnomish_Mines "Gnomish Mines").

A dwarf lord [can be generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") each of the following items:[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

- A 6⁄7 chance of a pair of [iron shoes](/wiki/Iron_shoes "Iron shoes") and an independent 6⁄7 chance of a [dwarvish cloak](/wiki/Dwarvish_cloak "Dwarvish cloak").

- A 1⁄4 chance of a [dwarvish short sword](/wiki/Dwarvish_short_sword "Dwarvish short sword") and [dwarvish iron helm](/wiki/Dwarvish_iron_helm "Dwarvish iron helm"), combined with an equal probability of either of the following:

  - A [dwarvish mattock](/wiki/Dwarvish_mattock "Dwarvish mattock"), or
  - A [dwarvish roundshield](/wiki/Dwarvish_roundshield "Dwarvish roundshield") paired with either a [dwarvish spear](/wiki/Dwarvish_spear "Dwarvish spear") or an [axe](/wiki/Axe "Axe"), with an equal probability for each weapon.
  - Dwarf lords that receive a dwarvish short sword and dwarvish iron helm also have a further 1⁄3 chance of receiving a [dwarvish mithril-coat](/wiki/Dwarvish_mithril-coat "Dwarvish mithril-coat").

- Dwarf lords that are not given a dwarvish short sword and dwarvish iron helm will instead receive either a [pick-axe](/wiki/Pick-axe "Pick-axe") (1⁄3 chance) or a [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger") (2⁄3 chance).

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

A dwarf will grow up into a dwarf leader of the appropriate gender, rather than always becoming a male dwarf lord regardless of gender.

## Strategy

Dwarf lords have two weapon attacks, which makes them quite deadly when wielding a dwarvish mattock, and they can have excellent [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") from their starting armor.

## History

The dwarf lord first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0"). From this version to [NetHack 3.0.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.3 "NetHack 3.0.3"), the dwarf lord uses the h glyph; in [NetHack 3.0.4](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.4 "NetHack 3.0.4"), when color was introduced, it was given the h glyph. The dwarf lord is given its current glyph color in [NetHack 3.0.7](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.7 "NetHack 3.0.7").

## Variants

Some variants grant dwarf lords and other monsters AC bonuses for wearing [racial equipment](/wiki/Racial_equipment "Racial equipment"), and may additionally generate them with a [potion of booze](/wiki/Potion_of_booze "Potion of booze"). They may also make adjustments so that female counterparts to the dwarf lord are properly named and generated.

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), the Gnomish Mines replaces dwarf lords with hostile [dwarf mummies](/wiki/Dwarf_mummies "Dwarf mummies") at level creation with the exception of [bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones"), so that player dwarves and gnomes will have to deal with hostile monsters like other races[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) - this does not occur in practice, since dwarf lords are never specified for generation when creating any of the Mines levels.

### GruntHack

In [GruntHack](/wiki/GruntHack "GruntHack"), dwarf lords are replaced by [racial monster](/wiki/Racial_monster "Racial monster") [lords and ladies](/wiki/Lord_\(GruntHack\) "Lord (GruntHack)"), which dwarves are eligible to generate as.

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), dwarf lords generated outside of the Gnomish Mines have a 6⁄7 chance of being generated with a potion of booze. They also gain +1 bonus AC for each piece of worn dwarven armor.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), dwarf lords that are randomly generated outside of the Gnomish Mines are always generated with a potion of booze.

Female dwarves will grow up into [dwarf clerics](/wiki/Dwarf_cleric "Dwarf cleric") rather than male dwarf lords.

Dwarf lords may appear in the court of a [throne room](/wiki/Throne_room#dNetHack "Throne room") ruled by a [gnome king](/wiki/Gnome_king "Gnome king"), [gnome queen](/wiki/Gnome_queen_\(dNetHack\) "Gnome queen (dNetHack)"), [dwarf king](/wiki/Dwarf_king "Dwarf king") or [dwarf queen](/wiki/Dwarf_queen_\(dNetHack\) "Dwarf queen (dNetHack)").

### xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), the monster is known as a **dwarf leader**. Dwarf leaders that generate with [dwarvish ring mail](/wiki/Dwarvish_ring_mail "Dwarvish ring mail") have an increased chance of it being made of [mithril](/wiki/Mithril "Mithril"), which makes it behave similarly to the dwarvish mithril-coat of *NetHack*.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), the monster is referred to as a **dwarf noble**, and dwarf nobles gain +1 bonus AC for each piece of worn dwarven armor.

### Hack'EM

In [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), the monster is also known as a dwarf noble as in EvilHack, and dwarf nobles gain +1 bonus AC for each piece of worn dwarven armor. Dwarf nobles generated outside of the Gnomish Mines have a 6⁄7 chance of being generated with a potion of booze, as in UnNetHack.

## Encyclopedia entry

Dwarfs have faces like men (ugly men, with wrinkled, leathery skins), but are generally either flat-footed, duck-footed, or have feet pointing backwards. They are of the earth, earthy, living in the darkest of caverns and venturing forth only with the cloaks by which they can make themselves invisible, and others disguised as toads. Miners often come across them, and sometimes establish reasonably close relations with them.... The miners of Cornwall were always delighted to hear a bucca busily mining away, for all dwarfs have an infallible nose for precious metals.  
Among other things, dwarfs are rightly valued for their skill as blacksmiths and jewellers: they made Odin his famous spear Gungnir, and Thor his hammer; for Freya they designed a magnificent necklace, and for Frey a golden boar. And in their spare time they are excellent bakers. Ironically, despite their odd feet, they are particularly fond of dancing. They can also see into the future, and consequently are excellent meteorologists. They can be free with presents to people they like, and a dwarvish gift is likely to turn to gold in the hand. But on the whole they are a snappish lot.

\[ The Immortals, by Derek and Julia Parker ]

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 367](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L367)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [sp\_lev.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 854](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/sp_lev.c#line854 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/sp lev.c")

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

Dwarf lord

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
h dwarf lord
Difficulty 6
Attacks Weapon 2d4, Weapon 2d4
h dwarf lord
Difficulty 6
Attacks

Weapon 2d4, Weapon 2d4

Base level 4
Base experience 51
Speed 6
Base AC 10
Base MR 10
Alignment 5 (lawful)
Frequency (by normal means) 2 (Quite rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 900
Nutritional value 300
Size Medium
Resistances None
Resistances conveyed None

A dwarf lord:

  • can tunnel through walls.
  • needs a pick-axe to tunnel through walls.
  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is a dwarf.
  • is a lord to its kind.
  • is male.
  • is strong.
  • likes gold.
  • likes gems.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • has infravision.
  • can be seen through infravision.
Reference monst.c#line461

A dwarf lord, h, is a type of monster that appears in NetHack. A dwarf lord is a humanoid monster that is a stronger type of dwarf, possessing infravision and the ability to tunnel with a digging tool like other dwarves.

A dwarf lord has two weapon attacks.

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

Dwarf lords are known as dwarf leaders, with "lord" and "lady" being gendered titles.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 History
  • 4 Variants
    • 4.1 SLASH'EM
    • 4.2 GruntHack
    • 4.3 UnNetHack
    • 4.4 dNetHack
    • 4.5 xNetHack
    • 4.6 EvilHack
    • 4.7 Hack'EM
  • 5 Encyclopedia entry
  • 6 References

Generation

Randomly-generated dwarf lords are always peaceful towards dwarven and gnomish characters, and will mostly be peaceful towards other lawful characters. Dwarf lords do not appear in Gehennom due to being lawful. A dwarf can grow up into a dwarf lord, and a dwarf lord can grow up into a dwarf king.

In addition to random generation, a dwarf lord may appear as the random h that is generated on level creation for each of the filler levels in the Gnomish Mines.

A dwarf lord can be generated with each of the following items:[1]

  • A 6⁄7 chance of a pair of iron shoes and an independent 6⁄7 chance of a dwarvish cloak.
  • A 1⁄4 chance of a dwarvish short sword and dwarvish iron helm, combined with an equal probability of either of the following:
    • A dwarvish mattock, or
    • A dwarvish roundshield paired with either a dwarvish spear or an axe, with an equal probability for each weapon.
    • Dwarf lords that receive a dwarvish short sword and dwarvish iron helm also have a further 1⁄3 chance of receiving a dwarvish mithril-coat.
  • Dwarf lords that are not given a dwarvish short sword and dwarvish iron helm will instead receive either a pick-axe (1⁄3 chance) or a dagger (2⁄3 chance).

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

A dwarf will grow up into a dwarf leader of the appropriate gender, rather than always becoming a male dwarf lord regardless of gender.

Strategy

Dwarf lords have two weapon attacks, which makes them quite deadly when wielding a dwarvish mattock, and they can have excellent AC from their starting armor.

History

The dwarf lord first appears in NetHack 3.0.0. From this version to NetHack 3.0.3, the dwarf lord uses the h glyph; in NetHack 3.0.4, when color was introduced, it was given the h glyph. The dwarf lord is given its current glyph color in NetHack 3.0.7.

Variants

Some variants grant dwarf lords and other monsters AC bonuses for wearing racial equipment, and may additionally generate them with a potion of booze. They may also make adjustments so that female counterparts to the dwarf lord are properly named and generated.

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, the Gnomish Mines replaces dwarf lords with hostile dwarf mummies at level creation with the exception of bones, so that player dwarves and gnomes will have to deal with hostile monsters like other races[2] - this does not occur in practice, since dwarf lords are never specified for generation when creating any of the Mines levels.

GruntHack

In GruntHack, dwarf lords are replaced by racial monster lords and ladies, which dwarves are eligible to generate as.

UnNetHack

In UnNetHack, dwarf lords generated outside of the Gnomish Mines have a 6⁄7 chance of being generated with a potion of booze. They also gain +1 bonus AC for each piece of worn dwarven armor.

dNetHack

In dNetHack, dwarf lords that are randomly generated outside of the Gnomish Mines are always generated with a potion of booze.

Female dwarves will grow up into dwarf clerics rather than male dwarf lords.

Dwarf lords may appear in the court of a throne room ruled by a gnome king, gnome queen, dwarf king or dwarf queen.

xNetHack

In xNetHack, the monster is known as a dwarf leader. Dwarf leaders that generate with dwarvish ring mail have an increased chance of it being made of mithril, which makes it behave similarly to the dwarvish mithril-coat of NetHack.

EvilHack

In EvilHack, the monster is referred to as a dwarf noble, and dwarf nobles gain +1 bonus AC for each piece of worn dwarven armor.

Hack'EM

In Hack'EM, the monster is also known as a dwarf noble as in EvilHack, and dwarf nobles gain +1 bonus AC for each piece of worn dwarven armor. Dwarf nobles generated outside of the Gnomish Mines have a 6⁄7 chance of being generated with a potion of booze, as in UnNetHack.

Encyclopedia entry

Dwarfs have faces like men (ugly men, with wrinkled, leathery skins), but are generally either flat-footed, duck-footed, or have feet pointing backwards. They are of the earth, earthy, living in the darkest of caverns and venturing forth only with the cloaks by which they can make themselves invisible, and others disguised as toads. Miners often come across them, and sometimes establish reasonably close relations with them.... The miners of Cornwall were always delighted to hear a bucca busily mining away, for all dwarfs have an infallible nose for precious metals.
Among other things, dwarfs are rightly valued for their skill as blacksmiths and jewellers: they made Odin his famous spear Gungnir, and Thor his hammer; for Freya they designed a magnificent necklace, and for Frey a golden boar. And in their spare time they are excellent bakers. Ironically, despite their odd feet, they are particularly fond of dancing. They can also see into the future, and consequently are excellent meteorologists. They can be free with presents to people they like, and a dwarvish gift is likely to turn to gold in the hand. But on the whole they are a snappish lot.

[ The Immortals, by Derek and Julia Parker ]

References

  1. ↑ src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 367
  2. ↑ sp_lev.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 854

{{ monster
 |name=dwarf lord
 |difficulty=6

 |AC=10

 |attributes={{attributes|A dwarf lord|tunnel=1|needpick=1|humanoid=1|omnivore=1|dwarf=1|strong=1|lord=1|male=1|greedy=1|jewels=1|collect=1|infravisible=1|infravision=1}}
 |size=Medium

 |weight=900
 |reference=[[monst.c#line461]]
}}

A '''dwarf lord''', {{monsym|dwarf lord}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''. A dwarf lord is a [[Humanoid (monster class)|humanoid]] monster that is a [[strong]]er type of [[Dwarf (monster attribute)|dwarf]], possessing [[infravision]] and the ability to [[tunnel]] with a digging tool like other dwarves.

A dwarf lord has two weapon attacks.

{{upcoming|3.7.0|Dwarf lords are known as '''dwarf leaders''', with "lord" and "lady" being gendered titles.}}

==Generation==
Randomly-generated dwarf lords are always peaceful towards [[Dwarf (starting race)|dwarven]] and [[Gnome (starting race)|gnomish]] characters, and will mostly be peaceful towards other [[lawful]] characters. Dwarf lords do not appear in [[Gehennom]] due to being lawful. A [[Dwarf (monster)|dwarf]] can [[grow up]] into a dwarf lord, and a dwarf lord can grow up into a [[dwarf king]].

In addition to random generation, a dwarf lord may appear as the random {{mcsl|h}} that is generated on level creation for each of the filler levels in the [[Gnomish Mines]].

A dwarf lord [[Monster starting inventory|can be generated with]] each of the following items:{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|367|nethack=3.6.7}}

* A {{frac|6|7}} chance of a pair of [[iron shoes]] and an independent {{frac|6|7}} chance of a [[dwarvish cloak]].
* A {{frac|4}} chance of a [[dwarvish short sword]] and [[dwarvish iron helm]], combined with an equal probability of either of the following:
** A [[dwarvish mattock]], or
** A [[dwarvish roundshield]] paired with either a [[dwarvish spear]] or an [[axe]], with an equal probability for each weapon.
** Dwarf lords that receive a dwarvish short sword and dwarvish iron helm also have a further {{frac|3}} chance of receiving a [[dwarvish mithril-coat]].
* Dwarf lords that are not given a dwarvish short sword and dwarvish iron helm will instead receive either a [[pick-axe]] ({{frac|3}} chance) or a [[dagger]] ({{frac|2|3}} chance).

{{upcoming|3.7.0|A dwarf will grow up into a dwarf leader of the appropriate gender, rather than always becoming a male dwarf lord regardless of gender.}}

==Strategy==
Dwarf lords have two weapon attacks, which makes them quite deadly when wielding a dwarvish mattock, and they can have excellent [[AC]] from their starting armor.

==History==
The dwarf lord first appears in [[NetHack 3.0.0]]. From this version to [[NetHack 3.0.3]], the dwarf lord uses the {{white|h}} glyph; in [[NetHack 3.0.4]], when color was introduced, it was given the {{brightred|h}} glyph. The dwarf lord is given its current glyph color in [[NetHack 3.0.7]].

==Variants==
Some variants grant dwarf lords and other monsters AC bonuses for wearing [[racial equipment]], and may additionally generate them with a [[potion of booze]]. They may also make adjustments so that female counterparts to the dwarf lord are properly named and generated.

===SLASH'EM===
In [[SLASH'EM]], the Gnomish Mines replaces dwarf lords with hostile [[dwarf mummies]] at level creation with the exception of [[bones]], so that player dwarves and gnomes will have to deal with hostile monsters like other races{{refsrc|sp_lev.c|854|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}} - this does not occur in practice, since dwarf lords are never specified for generation when creating any of the Mines levels.

===GruntHack===
In [[GruntHack]], dwarf lords are replaced by [[racial monster]] [[Lord (GruntHack)|lords and ladies]], which dwarves are eligible to generate as.

===UnNetHack===
In [[UnNetHack]], dwarf lords generated outside of the Gnomish Mines have a {{frac|6|7}} chance of being generated with a potion of booze. They also gain +1 bonus AC for each piece of worn dwarven armor.

===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]], dwarf lords that are randomly generated outside of the Gnomish Mines are always generated with a potion of booze.

Female dwarves will grow up into [[dwarf cleric]]s rather than male dwarf lords.

Dwarf lords may appear in the court of a [[Throne room#dNetHack|throne room]] ruled by a [[gnome king]], [[Gnome queen (dNetHack)|gnome queen]], [[dwarf king]] or [[Dwarf queen (dNetHack)|dwarf queen]].

===xNetHack===
In [[xNetHack]], the monster is known as a '''dwarf leader'''. Dwarf leaders that generate with [[dwarvish ring mail]] have an increased chance of it being made of [[mithril]], which makes it behave similarly to the dwarvish mithril-coat of ''NetHack''.

===EvilHack===
In [[EvilHack]], the monster is referred to as a '''dwarf noble''', and dwarf nobles gain +1 bonus AC for each piece of worn dwarven armor.

===Hack'EM===
In [[Hack'EM]], the monster is also known as a dwarf noble as in EvilHack, and dwarf nobles gain +1 bonus AC for each piece of worn dwarven armor. Dwarf nobles generated outside of the Gnomish Mines have a {{frac|6|7}} chance of being generated with a potion of booze, as in UnNetHack.

==Encyclopedia entry==
{{encyclopedia|
Dwarfs have faces like men (ugly men, with wrinkled, leathery skins), but are generally either flat-footed, duck-footed, or have feet pointing backwards.  They are of the earth, earthy, living in the darkest of caverns and venturing forth only with the cloaks by which they can make themselves invisible, and others disguised as toads.  Miners often come across them, and sometimes establish reasonably close relations with them.... The miners of Cornwall were always delighted to hear a bucca busily mining away, for all dwarfs have an infallible nose for precious metals.
Among other things, dwarfs are rightly valued for their skill as blacksmiths and jewellers: they made Odin his famous spear Gungnir, and Thor his hammer; for Freya they designed a magnificent necklace, and for Frey a golden boar.  And in their spare time they are excellent bakers.  Ironically, despite their odd feet, they are particularly fond of dancing.  They can also see into the future, and consequently are excellent meteorologists.  They can be free with presents to people they like, and a dwarvish gift is likely to turn to gold in the hand.  But on the whole they are a snappish lot.
|[ The Immortals, by Derek and Julia Parker ]
}}
